POKéMON.

short_effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon, and drops steadily to 1× at level 30.

effect:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to [catch]{mechanic:catch} a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of given by `(40 - level) / 10`, where `level` is the wild Pokémon's level, to a maximum of 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon's level is higher than 30, this ball has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a []{move:sunny-day} [TM]{item:tm11} in the house midway along the southern section of []{location:sinnoh-route-212}.

In Platinum, trade to [move tutors]{mechanic:move-tutor} on []{location:sinnoh-route-212}, in []{location:snowpoint-city}, and in the []{location:survival-area}.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a []{item:cheri-berry}, a []{item:leppa-berry}, and a []{item:pecha-berry} with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in []{location:violet-city}.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a []{item:persim-berry}, a []{item:pomeg-berry}, and a []{item:razz-berry} with the Juggler near the []{location:pal-park} entrance in []{location:fuchsia-city}.

effect:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.

refreshingly green field.

effect:
Held
:   [Experience]{mechanic:experience} is split across two groups: Pokémon who participated in battle, and Pokémon holding this item.  Each Pokémon earns experience as though it had battled alone, divided by the number of Pokémon in its group, then divided by the number of groups. Pokémon holding this item who also participated in battle effectively earn experience twice.

    [Fainted]{mechanic:fainted} Pokémon never earn experience, and empty groups are
ignored; thus, if a single Pokémon is holding this item and the only Pokémon who battled faints from []{move:explosion}, the holder will gain full experience.
flavor_text:
A hold item that
gets EXP. points
from battles.
name: Exp. Share
short_effect: Held: Half the experience from a battle is split between Pokémon holding this item.

:   Holder has 1.5× its [Attack]{mechanic:attack}.  When the holder attempts to use a move, all its other moves are disabled until it leaves battle or loses this item.

    The restriction ends even if this item is swapped for another Choice item
via []{move:trick} or []{move:switcheroo}.

power, but permits
only that move.

holders susceptible to Ground moves.

effect: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.

An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is tremendously heavy and makes
the holder move slower than usual.
name: Lagging Tail
short_effect: Held: Holder moves last in its priority bracket.

effect:
Held: Increases the holder's Speed by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)

the use of only one kind of move.

effect: Held: Damaged the holder for 1/8 its max HP.  When the holder is struck by a contact move, damages the attacker for 1/8 its max HP; if the attacker is not holding an item, it will take this item.
flavor_text:
A hold item that damages the holder on
every turn. It may latch on to foes
that touch the holder.

effect: Held: HP restored from Absorb, Aqua Ring, Drain Punch, Dream Eater, Giga Drain, Ingrain, Leech Life, Leech Seed, and Mega Drain is increased by 30%.  Damage inflicted is not affected.

power of HP-stealing moves to let the

effect:
Held: Increases the holder's Special Attack by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)

effect: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.
flavor_text:
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is
an exotic-smelling incense that makes
the holder bloated and slow moving.
name: Full Incense
short_effect: Held: Holder moves last in its priority bracket. Breeding: Snorlax begets a Munchlax Egg.

effect:
Used by trainer on a :pokemon:`Shaymin`
    Changes the target Shaymin from Land Forme to Sky Forme.

    This item cannot be used on a :mechanic:`frozen` Shaymin or at night.  Sky Forme Shaymin will revert to Land Forme overnight, when frozen, and upon entering a link battle.  This item must be used again to change it back.

A flower sometimes bundled in bouquets
to convey gratitude on special
occasions like birthdays.

short_effect: Changes an unfrozen Shaymin to Sky Forme in the day.

effect:
Used by trainer in battle
    Attempts to :mechanic:`catch` a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the trainer's Pokémon's level is higher than:
    * four times the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 8× normal.
    * than twice the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 4× normal.
    * the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 2× normal.

are a lower level than your own.

effect:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.

MAIL to be held by
a POKéMON.

flavor_text:
A handkerchief dropped by
a regular at Café Warehouse.
It smells faintly like a Pokémon.
name: Grubby Hanky
short_effect: Appears in the Café Warehouse on Sunday; return to the customer with a Patrat on Thursday.

flavor_text:
A special device that wrings out
the potential of Pokémon.
It is an imperfect prototype.
name: Colress Machine
short_effect: Wakes up the Crustle blocking the way in Seaside Cave.

flavor_text:
The Xtransceiver found at the
Nimbasa City amusement park.
It seems it belongs to a boy.
name: Dropped Item
short_effect: Returned to Curtis or Yancy as part of a sidequest.

flavor_text:
A glass that reveals the truth.
It is a mysterious glass that returns
a Pokémon back to its original shape.
name: Reveal Glass
short_effect: Switches Tornadus, Thundurus, and Landorus between Incarnate and Therian Forme.

flavor_text:

It’s a mysterious glass that returns
a Pokémon to its original shape.
name: Reveal Glass
short_effect: Switches Tornadus, Thundurus, and Landorus between Incarnate and Therian Forme.

flavor_text:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
Attack and Sp. Atk sharply increase
if the holder is hit with a move it’s weak to.
name: Weakness Policy

flavor_text:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This offensive vest raises Sp. Def
but prevents the use of status moves.
name: Assault Vest

flavor_text:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Fairy-type moves.
name: Pixie Plate

flavor_text:
A capsule that allows a Pokémon with
two Abilities to switch between these
Abilities when it is used.
name: Ability Capsule

flavor_text:
A soft and sweet treat made of fluffy,
puffy, whipped and whirled cream.
It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.
name: Whipped Dream

flavor_text:
A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes
that are just slightly too overwhelming.
Yet it’s loved by a certain Pokémon.
name: Sachet

flavor_text:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts Sp. Def if hit with a Water-
type attack. It can only be used once.
name: Luminous Moss

flavor_text:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts Attack if hit with an Ice-type
attack. It can only be used once.
name: Snowball

flavor_text:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
These goggles protect the holder from
both weather-related damage and powder.
name: Safety Goggles

flavor_text:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
It increases the Berry harvest without
the need for particularly diligent care.
name: Rich Mulch

flavor_text:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
It causes strange, sudden mutations
based on the combination of Berries.
name: Surprise Mulch

flavor_text:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
It increases the Berry harvest that
can be grown by diligent watering.
name: Boost Mulch

flavor_text:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
An amazing Mulch with the effects
of Rich, Surprise, and Boost Mulch.
name: Amaze Mulch

flavor_text:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Fairy-type attack.
name: Roseli Berry

flavor_text:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry
will increase the holder’s Defense
if it’s hit with a physical move.
name: Kee Berry

flavor_text:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
increase the holder’s Sp. Def
if it’s hit with a special move.
name: Maranga Berry

flavor_text:
This special coupon allows you to
buy items at a discount when you
are shopping at a boutique.
name: Discount Coupon

flavor_text:
An ornament depicting a Pokémon
that is venerated as a protector
in some region far from Kalos.
name: Strange Souvenir

flavor_text:
A popular treat in Lumiose City.
It can be used once to heal all the
status conditions of a Pokémon.
name: Lumiose Galette

flavor_text:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived on the land. It looks as
if it could be a piece of a large jaw.
name: Jaw Fossil

flavor_text:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived on the land. It looks
like the impression from a skin sail.
name: Sail Fossil

flavor_text:
A gem with an essence of the fey.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Fairy-type move one time.
name: Fairy Gem

flavor_text:
This book contains all the points a new
Trainer needs to know on a journey.
It was handmade by a kind friend.
name: Adventure Rules

flavor_text:
A card key that activates the elevator
in Lysandre Labs.
It is emblazoned with Team Flare’s logo.
name: Elevator Key

flavor_text:
A device that allows users to receive
and view hologram clips at any time.
It is also used to chat with others.
name: Holo Caster

flavor_text:
A precious symbol that is awarded
only to an individual who has done
great things for the Kalos region.
name: Honor of Kalos

flavor_text:
A rather curious stone that might
appear to be valuable to some.
It’s all in the eye of the beholder.
name: Intriguing Stone

flavor_text:
A rather chic-looking case
for carrying contact lenses.
name: Lens Case

flavor_text:
A ticket that was handmade by
Looker. It’s decorated with a
liberal amount of glittery paint.
name: Looker Ticket

flavor_text:
This ring contains an untold power that
somehow enables Pokémon carrying
Mega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.
name: Mega Ring

flavor_text:
This pass serves as an ID card
for gaining access to the power
plant that lies along Route 13.
name: Power Plant Pass

flavor_text:
A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote
to your mother. A faint but pleasant
perfume seems to cling to the paper.
name: Prof's Letter

flavor_text:
Attaches roller skates to the bottom
of your shoes, allowing you to glide
quickly around and perform tricks.
name: Roller Skates

flavor_text:
A watering can shaped like a Lotad.
It helps promote the healthy growth of
any Berries planted in good, soft soil.
name: Sprinklotad

flavor_text:
A commuter pass that allows the
holder to ride the TMV between Lumiose
City and Kiloude City at any time.
name: TMV Pass

flavor_text:
An attack that makes use of nature’s
power. Its effects vary depending on
the user’s environment.
name: TM96

flavor_text:
The user releases a horrible aura
imbued with dark thoughts. This
may also make the target flinch.
name: TM97

flavor_text:
Striking opponents over and over
makes the user’s fists harder.
Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
name: TM98

flavor_text:
The user damages opposing Pokémon
by emitting a powerful flash.
name: TM99

flavor_text:
The user tells the target a secret, and
the target loses its ability to concentrate.
This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
name: TM100
